data.enText: a movement or sound that you make to give sb information, instructions, a warning, etc.
a danger/warning/distress etc. signal

data.chText: 收到约定的信号后，他们离开了房间。
data.enText: At an agreed signal they left the room.

data.chText: 警报器一响，就是要所有人离开大楼。
data.enText: The siren was a signal for everyone to leave the building.
When I give the signal , run!

data.chText: 我什么时候拨他的电话听到的都是忙音。
data.enText: All I get is a busy signal when I dial his number (= his phone is being used) .

data.chText: 骑车人和驾车人的示意手势
data.enText: hand signals (= movements that cyclists and drivers make with their hands to tell other people that they are going to stop, turn, etc.)
an event, an action, a fact, etc. that shows that sth exists or is likely to happen

data.chText: 通货膨胀率的上升清楚地表明，政府的政策不起作用。
data.enText: The rise in inflation is a clear signal that the government's policies are not working.

data.chText: 胸部疼痛可能是心脏病的报警信号。
data.enText: Chest pains can be a warning signal of heart problems.

data.chText: 减刑会向犯罪分子发出错误的信号。
data.enText: Reducing prison sentences would send the wrong signals to criminals.

data.chText: （尤指铁路和公路上的）指示灯，信号灯，红绿灯
data.enText: a piece of equipment that uses different coloured lights to tell drivers to go slower, stop, etc., used especially on railways/railroads and roads
traffic signals
a stop signal

data.chText: （传输声音、图像或其他信息的电波）信号
data.enText: a series of electrical waves that carry sounds, pictures or messages, for example to a radio or television
TV signals
a high frequency signal
a radar signal
to detect/pick up signals
to emit a signal
-ll-
to make a movement or sound to give sb a message, an order, etc.

data.chText: 等我发出信号后再开枪。
data.enText: Don't fire until I signal.
Did you signal before you turned right?
He signalled to the waiter for the bill.
The referee signalled a foul.
She signalled (that) it was time to leave.

data.chText: 他示意要我们去他那儿。
data.enText: He signalled to us to join him.

data.hoverText: 动词+名词短语+带to的不定式

data.enText: She signalled him to follow.

data.chText: 你要朝哪个方向转，必须发出信号。
data.enText: You must signal which way you are going to turn.
to be a sign that sth exists or is likely to happen

data.chText: 这个声明显示政策有明显的改变。
data.enText: This announcement signalled a clear change of policy.

data.chText: 毫无疑问，这桩丑闻预示他的政治生涯就此结束。
data.enText: The scandal surely signals the end of his political career.
to do sth to make your feelings or opinions known
He signalled his discontent by refusing to vote.

data.chText: 她表示愿意作为候选人参加竞选。
data.enText: She has signalled (that) she is willing to stand as a candidate.
important
a signal honour

data.chText: 他们显然没有履行自己的竞选承诺。
data.enText: They have signally failed to keep their election promises.

data.text: sign ♦ indication ♦ symptom ♦ symbol ♦ indicator ♦ signal

data.chText: 以上各词均指迹象、征兆、预兆。
data.enText: These are all words for an event, action or fact that shows that sth exists, is happening or may happen in the future.
sign
an event, action or fact that shows that sth exists, is happening or may happen in the future

data.chText: 头痛可能是紧张的迹象。
data.enText: Headaches may be a sign of stress.
indication
( rather formal ) a remark or sign that shows that sth is happening or what sb is thinking or feeling

data.chText: 他们根本没说明这项工作该怎样做。
data.enText: They gave no indication as to how the work should be done.

data.chText: indication常通过某人的说话表明，而sign通常为发生的事或某人所做的事。
data.enText: An indication often comes in the form of sth that sb says, while a sign is usually sth that happens or sth that sb does.
sign or indication?
symptom
a change in your body or mind that shows that you are not healthy; a sign that sth exists, especially sth bad
Symptoms include a sore throat.

data.chText: 通胀上升不过是经济不景气的一个征候。
data.enText: The rise in inflation was just one symptom of the poor state of the economy.
symbol
a person, object or event that represents a more general quality or situation

data.chText: 鸽子是和平的共同象征。
data.enText: The dove is a universal symbol of peace.
indicator
( rather formal ) a sign that shows you what sth is like or how a situation is changing
the economic indicators
signal
an event, action or fact that shows that sth exists, is happening or may happen in the future

data.chText: 胸部疼痛可能是心脏病的报警信号。
data.enText: Chest pains can be a warning signal of heart problems.

data.chText: signal常用以指应该采取行动的暗号、信号；sign通常不用于此义：
data.enText: Signal is often used to talk about an event, action or fact that suggests to sb that they should do sth. Sign is not usually used in this way.
Reducing prison sentences would send the wrong signs to criminals.
sign or signal?
a(n) sign/indication/symptom/symbol/indicator/signal of sth
a(n) sign/indication/indicator/signal that…
a(n) clear/definite/distinct/obvious sign/indication/symptom/indicator/signal
an early sign/indication/symptom/indicator/signal
an outward sign/indication/symptom/symbol
to give a(n) sign/indication/signal
A sign/symbol means sth.
All the signs/indications are/point to…

simple_means.memory_skill: sign 信号 + al 表物 → 信号

means: (尤指铁路和公路上的)指示灯，信号灯，红绿灯

tr: any nonverbal action or gesture that encodes a message
example: signals from the boat suddenly stopped
he awaited the signal to start
the victory was a signal for wild celebration

tr: an electric quantity (voltage or current or field strength) whose modulation represents coded information about the source from which it comes
be a signal for or a symptom of
example: These symptoms indicate a serious illness
Her behavior points to a severe neurosis
The economic indicators signal that the euro is undervalued

tr: communicate silently and non-verbally by signals or signs
example: He signed his disapproval with a dismissive hand gesture
The diner signaled the waiters to bring the menu
the year saw one signal triumph for the Labour party

value.boxr_value: in AM, use 美国英语用 signaling, signaled

value.def: A signal is a gesture, sound, or action which is intended to give a particular message to the person who sees or hears it.

example.tran: 他们发射了3次求救信号。

example.ex: As soon as it was dark, Mrs Evans gave the signal...
example.tran: 天一黑，埃文斯夫人就发出了信号。

example.ex: You mustn't fire without my signal.

value.tran: (以手势、声音、行动等发出的)信号，暗号

value.def: If you signal to someone, you make a gesture or sound in order to send them a particular message.

example.ex: The United manager was to be seen frantically signalling to McClair...
example.tran: 一会儿可以看到曼联主教练拼命地朝麦克莱尔示意。

example.ex: He stood up, signalling to the officer that he had finished with his client...
example.tran: 他站起身，向警察示意他和他的当事人已经谈完了。

example.ex: She signalled a passing taxi and ordered him to take her to the rue Marengo.
example.tran: 她招手打了一辆路过的出租车，让司机载她去马伦戈街。

value.tran: (用手势、声音等)发信号，发暗号，示意

value.def: If an event or action is a signal of something, it suggests that this thing exists or is going to happen.

example.ex: Kurdish leaders saw the visit as an important signal of support...
example.tran: 库尔德领导人将这次访问视作一种表示支持的重要信号。

example.ex: The first warning signals came in March...
example.tran: 第一次警示出现在3月份。

example.ex: The Red Cross said it is withdrawing its staff until they receive clear signals from all sides that their presence is welcomed.
example.tran: 红十字会称他们正在撤回所属职员，直到各方都明确表示欢迎他们的存在。

value.def: If someone or something signals an event, they suggest that the event is happening or likely to happen.

example.ex: She will be signalling massive changes in energy policy...
example.tran: 她将暗示能源政策会有重大变化。

example.ex: Britain was signalling its readiness to have the embargo lifted...
example.tran: 英国表示愿意取消贸易禁令。

example.ex: The outcome of that meeting could signal whether there truly exists a political will to begin negotiating.
example.tran: 那次会议的结果会表明是否真正存在想要开始谈判的政治意愿。

value.def: A signal is a piece of equipment beside a railway, which indicates to train drivers whether they should stop the train or not.
A signal is a series of radio waves, light waves, or changes in electrical current which may carry information.
value.tran: (传输信息的无线电、光波或电流)信号

value.def: You use signal to describe a success or failure when you are emphasizing the fact that it has occurred and are indicating that the consequences are significant.

example.ex: His final round was a signal triumph in a career marked by many sweet moments.
example.tran: 最后一场比赛的胜利在他充满欣喜的职业生涯中具有非凡的意义。

example.ex: ...John Major's signal failure to grab America's attention.
example.tran: 约翰·梅杰显然没有能够引起美国的注意

example.ex: ...a demoralised party which its leader signally failed to reassure.
example.tran: 该政党士气低落，而其领袖丝毫未能安定人心

partsOfSpeech.dec: as 加强 + sign 记号，信号 → 一再给人信号 → 指定 → 指定人后分配工作 → 分配
assign 分配；指定 + ment 表名词 → 分配；指定
con 共同 + sign 记号，信号 → 做了记号放在一起 → 委托；寄存
consign 委托；寄存 + ment 表名词 → 交付；委托
de 使… + sign 记号，信号 → 使有记号可循 → 设计
de 使… + sign 记号，信号 + ate 做，造成，使… → 发出信号 → 指示
de 使… + sign 记号，信号 + ation 行为，过程，状态，结果 → 指定；任命
en 使… + sign 记号，信号 → 成为国家、军舰的记号 → 国旗；军舰旗
in 使… + sign 记号，信号 + ia 某种病 → 使成为记号 → 标识
re 重新 + sign 记号，信号 → 重新做记号 → 再签字 → 辞职
re 重新 + sign 记号，信号 + ation，resign 的名词 → 辞职
sign 记号，信号 + al 表物 → 信号
signal 信号 + ize 使 → 通知；发信号
signa〔= sign〕记号，信号 + ture 表行为 → 标上记号 → 签名
sign 记号，信号 + et 小 → 小记号 → 图章
signi〔= sign〕记号，信号 + fic 做 + ance 表性质 → 做记号 →〔有〕意义
signi〔= sign〕记号，信号 + fic 具有某种性质的 + ant …的 → 有意义的
sign 记号，信号 + ify 使 → 用信号表示 → 象征
